section.title: Current News
section.p: Committers should feel free to update these pages with relevant news about their projects. Be sure to see the information about updating the xml.apache.org website in the guidelines.

section.title: Forrest website launched (June 1, 2002)
section.p: The Forrest team will be gradually rebuilding the xml.apache.org website into a true developer community for Apache XML technology. Check us out.

section.title: Cocoon 2.0.2 released (March 26, 2002)
section.p: The Apache Cocoon team is proud to announce the release of Cocoon 2.0.2. The distribution is available from the download pages.

section.title: Cocoon 2.0.1 released (January 31, 2002)
section.p: The Apache Cocoon team is proud to announce the release of Cocoon 2.0.1. The distribution is available from the download pages.

section.title: Xerces 2.0.0 (beta) is released
section.p: The beta release for Xerces2 marks the first step in producing the next generation of Xerces XML parser technology. Xerces2 beta is available from the download pages.

section.title: xml-commons subproject is formed! (Summer-01)
section.p: A new subproject focusing on sharing common XML code and interfaces, etc. was formed recently. For details, look in the xml-commons repository, in the general@xml.apache.org mailing list, or the commons-dev@xml.apache.org mailing list.

section.title: Xalan-J was nominated for an award! (Summer-01)
section.p:
Dear Apache XML Project,
Congratulations! JavaWorld has selected the Apache XML Project's Xalan-Java 1.2.2 as a finalist in the Best Java-XML Application category of our Editors' Choice Awards. Established in 1997, the awards recognize those innovative companies, organizations, and individuals committed to developing new Java tools and technologies that drive the platform forward. More than 100 products and technologies were nominated by vendors, readers, as well as JavaWorld editors and writers. We'll publish the complete list of finalists in each category by 5 p.m. PDT on Friday, May 4 (go to: http://www.javaworld.com/jw-05-2001/jw-0504-finalists.html).

As a finalist, members of your product team will be invited to attend JavaWorld's Editors' Choice Awards ceremony at the JavaOne Conference and Expo from June 4-8 in San Francisco, where a winner in each category will be announced.

Regards, Scott Plamondon
Senior Editor
JavaWorld

section.title: Batik was nominated for an award! (Sep-01)
section.p: Some details were posted onthe general mailing list

section.title: Batik Status: Source Code and Binaries Available
section.p: Batik, the Java Based toolkit for applications that want to use images in the Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) format is finally available on our download pages!

section.title: Xang - Source code for XPages from Datachannel released
section.p: Xang, the new code name of the XPages project from DataChannel is currently available in source form for download. Check out the download pages for the source.

section.title: Crimson - Source code for Project X from Sun released
section.p: Crimson, the code name of the XML Parser Project X from Sun is currently available in source form for download. Check out the download pages for the source.
The current production release is Crimson 1.1.2beta2(Sep-01). Work on Crimson is mostly limited to bugfixing; discussions take place on general@xml.apache.org.

section.title: Xerces status: Source Code and Binaries Available
section.p: Xerces XML parsers in Java, C++, Perl, and COM are currently available in source code and binary form. Check out the download pages for binaries and source!
The current production release is Xerces-J 1.4.3 (Sep-01). Work on 1.x is mostly limited to bugfixing; most of the Xerces community is moving forward with Xerces 2.x codebase.

section.title: Xalan Status: Source Code and Binaries Available
section.p: Xalan XSLT stylesheet processor in Java is currently available in source code and binary form. Check out the download pages for binaries and source!

section.title: Cocoon Status: Source Code and Binaries Available
section.p: Cocoon, the XML-based web publishing solution in Java, is available. Check out the download pages for binaries and sources.

section.title: FOP Status: Source Code and Binaries Available
section.p: FOP, the XSL:FO formatting objects processor in Java, is currently available in source code and binary form. Check out the download pages for binaries and source!
